newsitem.title: USA: Florida legislature approves budget, adjourns.
newsitem.headline: Florida legislature approves budget, adjourns.

text.p: Florida's Legislature has approved a $42.2 billion budget for fiscal 1998 and adjourned its annual session.
The budget agreement passed 36-2 in the Senate and 107-11 in the House late Friday. The budget now goes to Gov. Lawton Chiles, who has a line-item veto.

The budget raised spending by 5.5 percent over this year without adding new taxes, though students at state colleges and universities face tuition increases of 7.8 percent to 12.8 percent. Most of the new revenue resulted from economic expansion.
The budget contains $1.28 billion of new general obligation bonds.
It allocates $11 billion for public education, an increase of $610 millior this year. Spending rose by $207.4 million for social services, and by $81.3 million for criminal justice.
